articles.title: Professor Neil Ferguson on the Covid year that shattered our way of life – podcast - The Guardian
articles.description: Prof Neil Ferguson was one of the first scientists to raise the alarm in Britain that unless the government radically changed policy, it was heading for a disaster that the NHS could not cope with

articles.title: Understanding how porphyry-type copper deposits are formed may lead to new resources - study - MINING.COM - MINING.com
articles.description: UK-based researchers found the missing link in models that explain the formation of porphyry-type copper deposits.
articles.content: Their geology makes porphyry deposits rare, while most large near-surface examples have already been found. This means that understanding how and where they form can be of interest for mining compani… [+1699 chars]

articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Asteroid FO32: How to see 2021's biggest asteroid pass Earth TODAY - Astronomer's tips - Daily Express
articles.description: ASTEROID FO32 will safely swing past Earth later this afternoon, offering amateur astronomers a unique opportunity to track the 2,300-ft-wide space rock. Express.co.uk explains everything you need to know about Asteroid FO32's flyby.

articles.author: RT
articles.title: Cosmic shower: Locals report seeing bright ‘meteors’ in Britain, Cuba and US (VIDEOS) - RT
articles.description: Residents in the UK and Cuba have described seeing shiny objects falling from the sky, which were followed by a loud noise. Unconfirmed meteor sightings were also reported in the US.
articles.content:
A dashcam recorded a bright ball of light flying across the sky over the island of Jersey, a British territory in the English Channel.
Around the same time, locals in the UK reported hearing a loud … [+2087 chars]

articles.title: Plans for sustainable city on Mars are unveiled, with hopes of beginning construction in 33 years - Daily Mail
articles.description: Nüwa, the capital city and one of five planned, is built vertically instead of horizontally into the side of a cliff, which would diminish the effect of atmospheric pressure and radiation.
articles.content: As humans continue to explore Mars, plans are already underway to build a sustainable city on the red planet. The plans were unveiled by architecture studio ABIBOO, which has offices around the world… [+4383 chars]

articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Life after death: Bill Nye says 'overwhelming evidence' proves there is no afterlife - Daily Express
articles.description: LIFE after death does not exist, at least according to science communicator Bill Nye the Science Guy who thinks there is 'overwhelming evidence' against the conventional idea of an afterlife.
